trial_identification.studytitle: A pilot study to investigate vitamin D status and its associations with dietary vitamin D intake, sunlight exposure and selected health outcomes in peritoneal dialysis and hemodialysis patients attending the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital renal unit.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pilot study to investigate vitamin D status and its associations with dietary vitamin D intake, sunlight exposure, kidney disease, bone disease, inflammation, metabolic syndrome and quality of life in peritoneal dialysis and hemodialysis patients.

interventions.interventions: Vitamin D intake from diet and supplements for the previous month assessed by questionnaire. Sunlight exposure for the previous month assessed by questionnaire. Serum vitamin D concentration (25(OH)D on the day of dialysis clinic visit (peritoneal dialysis patients) or during their usual hemodialysis sessions (hemodialysis patients).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Malnutrition status - assessed using Patient Generated Subjective Global Assessment Body mass index - assessed using height & dry weight measures Energy and micro-nutrient intake - assessed using a 4day food diary completed over 7 days (including 1 weekend day)
primaryOutcome.timepoint:
Patient generated subjective global assessment - assessed at time of clinic visit. Body mass index - assessed at time of clinic visit.
Energy & micronutrient intake - assessed 4 days over a 7 day period following the clinic visit.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Dialysis duration - assessed from medical records Dialysis adequacy - Assessed using urea clearance, dialysis time and total body water (Kt/V) Estimated glomerular filtration rate - Assessed using serum creatinine, age and body weight Potassium - serum potassium concentration analysis Urea - serum urea concentration analysis Albumin - serum albumin concentration analysis Phosphate - serum phosphate concentration analysis Calcium X phosphate - serum calcium X phosphate concentration analyses
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Dialysis duration - assessed at time of clinic visit. Dialysis adequacy - assessed at time of clinic visit over duration of dialysis - usually 4-5 hours estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate - assessed at time of clinic visit. Potassium - assessed at time of clinic visit. Urea - assessed at time of clinic visit. Phosphate - assessed at time of clinic visit. Calcium X phosphate - assessed at time of clinic visit.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Markers of inflammation Pentraxin 3 - blood analysis C reactive protein- blood analysis Interleukin-6 - blood analysis Interleukin-10 - blood analysis Interleukin-12 - blood analysis Tumour-necrosis factor alpha - blood analysis asssessed in peritoneal dialysis patients.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pentraxin 3, C reactive protein, Interleukin-6, Interleukin-10, Interleukin-12, Tumour-necrosis factor alpha - all assessed at time of clinic visit.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Kidney disease quality of life questionnaire score (KDQOL)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: KDQOL - assessed at time of clinic visit.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Bone status Bone morphogenic protein 7 - blood analysis Bone-specific alkaline phosphatase - blood analysis n-terminal cross-linking telopeptide of type I collagen - urine analysis Parathyroid hormone - blood analysis in peritoneal dialysis patients.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Bone morphogenic protein 7, Bone-specific alkaline phosphatase , n-terminal cross-linking telopeptide of type I collagen, Parathyroid hormone - all assessed at time of clinic visit for peritoneal dialysis patients.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Metabolic syndrome status Serum lipids - blood analysis Urinary albumin - Urine analysis Diabetes/prediabetes status - Medical records Blood pressure - Mercury sphygmanometer
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Serum lipids, Urinary albumin, Diabetes/prediabetes status, Blood pressure - all assessed at time of clinic visit.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Chronic kidney disease patients on peritoneal dialysis or hemodialysis Attending the home and independent dialysis unit at the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnant women Patients unable to communicate in English Patient lacking the cognitive ability to participate or give informed consent

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Victoria Park Road Kelvin Grove Queensland 4059

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Victoria Park Road Kelvin Grove Queensland 4059

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the study is to investigate vitamin D and health in people with chronic kidney disease who are using peritoneal dialysis or hemodialysis. As part of the study we want to find out whether people using peritoneal dialysis have low vitamin D levels in their blood and how much vitamin D they get from food and sunlight exposure. We also want to find out whether low vitamin D is related to adverse health outcomes. Study hypotheses (alternative hypotheses) 1) Low intake of vitamin D & exposure to sunlight will be associated with low blood levels of vitamin D 2) Low blood levels of vitamin D will be associated with adverse health outcomes
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Martensen, Renee, Ash, Susan, Healy, Helen, Fassett, Robert, Kimlin, Michael, Cardinal, John, et al. (2012) Vitamin D intake, sun exposure and 25-hydroxy vitamin D status in Peritoneal dialysis (PD) and Haemodialysis (HD) patients. Oral Presentation. 16th International Congress of Dietetics, 5-8 September 2012, Sydney Convention & Exhibition Centre, Sydney, NSW.
